column4: so outside of revu and bugs.deb.... where should I be pointing people?
i'm sure my userbase will be happy to absolutely inundate whatever forum is needed to get mangler into ubuntu
what is the issue you currently have, lets see if we can help
i have a software package that I've been trying to get into ubuntu repos since Dec 2009
ok - what have you done to get it into the repos
ok - so you've logged a wishlist request, what else have you done ?
ok - so you've built the package and submitted it to the motu process ?
it's a license issue, that's the issue
the license issue was resolved months ago....
it seems like reasonable requests, (I've just got to the bottom)
it does matter to call out the correct license, and it's a trivial change
just make the changes and submit, it will get there
and on a side issue thank you for submitting, it will be a good tool to have
guess there is nothing more to be done then,
no point discussing it further then as the revu process is the correct process
so i just checked the svn logs... that copyright change was made on jul/23/2010 to comply with revu
send a mail to the motu guys or ask in #ubuntu-motu for a status update
